content:
Hey,
I saw that <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/72480> is open for half a year now and thus decided to try to do my first stabililzation.
There is still an open question so I wanted to get some feedback to resolve the remaining problems.

The rustc-dev-guide says that there has to be a Stabilization Report, but I looked into some other feature stabilizations and if the change was really small, the stabilization report was skipped. So I guess I can do the same here and skip the report?

If everything is fine and there are no blockers I'm ready to open the Stabilization PR, and also adjust the documentation.

cc @Joshua Nelson
Yes, that's fine - the dev guide is mostly biased towards compiler and language changes
but yes it would be great to have this stable :)
